courses.description: Students will develop computational thinking skills vital for success across all disciplines, such as using computational tools to analyze and study data and working with large data sets to analyze, visualize, and draw conclusions from trends.This course is unique in its focus on fostering student creativity.

Through this course, students will learn the basics of architectural principles, including spatial design, structural concepts, and the relationship between form and function. Ideal for those interested in exploring careers in architecture, urban planning, or interior design.

Studnets will master traditional drafting and sketching techniques in addition to learning to use industry-standard CAD (computer-aided design) software. Exploration of ergonomic design, industrial design, and product redesign will also take place throughout the course.

courses.teacher: Mrs. Leonard, Mrs. Russo, & Mr. Werntz
courses.description: Students will participate in dynamic and competitive activities that emphasize critical and creative thinking. This course promotes leadership skills and career awareness.
Students will participate in dynamic and competitive activities that emphasize critical and creative thinking. This course promotes leadership skills and career awareness.
courses.alt: AI image of innovation and design.

courses.description: Provides an overview of technology's impact on society, including its historical context, current effects, and potential future developments.

In-depth exploration of the historical impacts that innovations in mass media have had on cultures, both past and present. Dtudents will develop an appreciation for the power of media and learn the steps involved in the film creation process.

This course discusses the concepts and skills required to plan, design and build advanced websites, with a focus on sophisticated user interaction enabled by programming the web browser (such as Chrome). This course takes place over 3 years.

In this course, students learn craftsmanship through established industry standards including the latest technological techniques. Students implement lessons in advanced machine operations, joinery, cabinet construction, and finishing.

clubs.description: Students are part of an organizaton where they can compete in various exciting competitions ranging from technology challenges to structural engineering.
requirements: See more information on TSA website

clubs.description: The Mustang Morning Show is aired on the last Friday of every month. It recaps the month with fun games, activites, news, and sports.
requirements: See more information on Mustang Morning Show website

clubs.description: Coding and Coffee occurs every friday with tutoring and extra help available in the morning. Occasionally, food and snacks will be offered along with building deeper connections through coding.
requirements: See more information on Coffee & Coding website
